etymology.description: Depicts a human with crossed legs -> person interacting -> concept of mixing or exchange
etymology.interpretation: The character 交(交) (xiāo, "to mix") visually represents a person with crossed legs, symbolizing interaction or meeting, which conveys the idea of mixing or exchanging.

examples.chinese: 厨师把香料交入汤中(廚師把香料交入湯中)。
examples.pinyin: Chúshī bǎ xiāngliào xiāo rù tāng zhōng.
examples.english: The chef mixes the spices into the soup.

examples.chinese: 他把红色交蓝色(他把紅色交藍色)，调成了紫色(調成了紫色)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ hóngsè xiāo lánsè, tiáo chéng le zǐsè.
examples.english: He mixes red and blue to turn them into purple.

examples.chinese: 艺术家善于交不同元素(藝術家善於交不同元素)，创造出独特风格(創造出獨特風格)。
examples.pinyin: Yìshùjiā shànyú xiāo bùtóng yuánsù, chuàngzào chū dútè fēnggé.
examples.english: The artist is good at mixing different elements to create a unique style.
